elements.title: Pokémon Crystal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Japanese version of Pokémon Crystal allowed players to trade and battle over mobile networks using an adapter (pictured)?

elements.title: Jacques Loew (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jacques Loew started the worker-priest movement after working as a longshoreman and realizing the distance between the priesthood and the working class?

elements.title: their first season in 1971 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Barcelona Femení were unbeaten in their first season in 1971 when their captain announced that she would leave football?

elements.title: Thomas Young (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Thomas Young, a professor of midwifery, was taken prisoner at the Battle of Prestonpans?

elements.title: self-titled EP (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Giorgio Moroder co-wrote and recorded a poem about seduction in Italian for Kylie and Garibay's self-titled EP?

elements.title: Jason Jones-Hughes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Australia-born rugby union player Jason Jones-Hughes was the subject of a protracted legal battle over his international eligibility after Wales called him up for the 1999 Rugby World Cup?

elements.title: Verteba Cave (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 28 Jews hid in Verteba Cave for almost six months during the Holocaust?

elements.title: Joseph Drummond (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Joseph Drummond, a key figure of New Brunswick's branch of the NAACP, staged a sit-in at a local barbershop whose owner proclaimed that he had "never cut a colored person's hair in 55 years"?

elements.title: arithmetic (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 1 + 1 = 1, according to some forms of non-Diophantine arithmetic?
